basics.name: Rachel R. Langgin
basics.label: Second-year Astronomy PhD Student
basics.summary: Graduate Astronomy Student at the University of Nevada-Las Vegas, Research Assistant with the LIGO Scientific Collaboration, NV NASA Graduate Research Fellow (2024-2025)

education.institution: University of Nevada-Las Vegas, Las Vegas

education.thesis: Spectral Analysis of Red and Blue Quasars and their Effect on Galactic Evolution

education.institution: Las Vegas Academy of the Arts

researchExperience.name: LIGO Scientific Collaboration, University of Nevada-Las Vegas, Las Vegas, NV, USA
researchExperience.summary: Graduate astronomy student researcher studying compact object binaries through gravitational-wave analysis with the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory (LIGO) Scientific Collaboration (LSC), advised by Dr. Carl-Johan Haster.

researchExperience.name: Glikman Lab (Remote) & Masters Galaxy Group, Haverford College, Haverford, PA, USA
researchExperience.summary: Conducted my undergraduate senior thesis using a radio, infrared, and optically selected sample of blue quasars to put dust-reddened red quasars in context. We found a radio-selection dependency and the fraction of red quasars to be 32% in order to complete the UKFS and W2M surveys; advised by Dr. Eilat Glikman & Dr. Karen Masters.

researchExperience.name: Glikman Lab, Middlebury College, Middlebury, VT, USA
researchExperience.position: Keck Northeast Astronomy Consortium Research Scholar
researchExperience.summary: Studied a candidate dual quasar system using Hubble Space Telescope data and completed a spectroscopic analysis of the closely separated sources with StisTools and found the possible QSO system links dust-reddening to galaxy and black hole mergers; advised by Dr. Eilat Glikman

researchExperience.name: Masters Galaxy Group, Haverford College, Haverford, PA, USA
researchExperience.summary: Researched various intrinsic parameters of galactic bars using SDSS MaNGA data, including bar length and position angle, to complete a population comparison analysis, and participated in weekly group journal presentations; advised by Dr. Karen Masters

researchExperience.name: Masters Galaxy Group, Haverford College, Haverford, PA, USA (Remote)
researchExperience.position: Marian E. Koshland Integrated Natural Science Center Summer Researcher & Fellow
researchExperience.summary: Investigated galaxy kinematics and bar formation, performed elliptical isophote analysis with Photutils on MaNGA galaxies. Participated in HI data reduction, GalaxyZoo classifications, radon transform classifications, daily team collaborations, and weekly journal clubs.

researchExperience.name: Bryn Mawr Plasma Laboratory, Bryn Mawr College, Bryn Mawr, PA, USA (Remote)
researchExperience.summary: Curated interactive Jupyter notebooks to cover college-level physics concepts and lessons focused on electromagnetism; advised and funded by Dr. David Schaffner.

teachingExperience.name: University of Nevada-Las Vegas, Las Vegas, NV, USA
teachingExperience.summary: AST 105: Introductory Astronomy Laboratory, Advised by Dr. David Jeffery

teachingExperience.name: University of Nevada-Las Vegas, Las Vegas, NV, USA
teachingExperience.summary: PHYS 196: Electrical Engineering Laboratory, Advised by Dr. Thomas Hurst

teachingExperience.name: Haverford College Astrophysics Department, Haverford, PA, USA
teachingExperience.summary: Intro to Coding for Physics and Astronomy, Advised by Dr. Andrea Lommen

teachingExperience.name: Haverford College Astrophysics Department, Haverford, PA, USA
teachingExperience.summary: Advanced Classical Mechanics following textbook by Taylor, Advised by Dr. Ted Brzinski

employment.summary: Advised by Laura Surtees & Joyce B. Angelucci

employment.name: Residential Life, Bryn Mawr College, Bryn Mawr, PA, USA
Dining Services, Bryn Mawr College, Bryn Mawr, PA, USA
employment.position: Student Supervisor in Erdman and New Dorm Dining Hall

astronomyOutreach.name: Las Vegas Astronomical Society, Las Vegas, NV, USA
astronomyOutreach.summary: Invited speaker for the Las Vegas Astronomical Society chapter public educational Star Parties and meeting speaker operating under the College of Southern Nevada Planetarium, Dr. Andrew Kerr, Director.

astronomyOutreach.name: Astronomy on Tap, Astronomy Aleworks, Las Vegas, NV, USA
astronomyOutreach.summary: Co-organizer with colleagues at the Nevada Center for Astrophysics to share the excitement of astronomy and astrophysics with the general public and local community.

astronomyOutreach.name: Science Fair Judge, Canyon Springs Highschool, Las Vegas, NV, USA
astronomyOutreach.summary: Led the adjudication of annual science fairs for middle and high school students, evaluating projects for creativity, scientific rigor, and presentation skills.

astronomyOutreach.name: Strawbridge Observatory, Haverford College, Haverford, PA, USA
astronomyOutreach.summary: Operated 12 and 16 inch telescopes to explain astrophysical concepts to students and community members while navigating the night sky through the constellations.

astronomyOutreach.name: Mittleman Observatory, Middlebury College, Middlebury, VT, USA
astronomyOutreach.summary: Operated 8 and 11 inch telescopes to explain basic astronomical phenomena in both English and Spanish for Middlebury Language School students and community members while promoting dark skies.

awards,HonorsAndCertificates.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.
